org.xbmc.httpapi.client

Class ControlClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbmc.httpapi.client.ControlClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IClient, IControlClient

    public class ControlClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements IControlClient
    The ControlClient class takes care of everything related to controlling XBMC. These are essentially play controls, navigation controls other actions the user may wants to execute. It equally reads the information instead of setting it.
    Author:
    Team XBMC

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.xbmc.api.data.IControlClient

      • seek

        public boolean seek(INotifiableManager manager,
           SeekType type,
           int progress)
        Seeks to a position. If type is
        • absolute - Sets the playing position of the currently playing media as a percentage of the media???s length.
        • relative - Adds/Subtracts the current percentage on to the current position in the song
        Specified by:
        seek in interface IControlClient
        Parameters:
        manager - Manager reference
        type - Seek type, relative or absolute
        progress - Progress
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise.

      • setBroadcast

        public boolean setBroadcast(INotifiableManager manager,
                   int port,
                   int level)
        Sets the brodcast level and port. Level currently only takes three values:
        • 0 - No broadcasts
        • 1 - Media playback and startup & shutdown events
        • 2 - "OnAction" events (e.g. buttons) as well as level 1 events.
        Specified by:
        setBroadcast in interface IControlClient
        Parameters:
        manager - Manager reference
        port - Broadcast port
        level - Broadcast level
        Returns:
        True on success, false otherwise.
